page.title: 19Farming around Barnt Green
page.content: The majority of the{farmland}around the villages of Barnt Green, Cofton Hackett and Hopwood is intensively managed grassland. The landscape is dominated by rolling fields of lush grass which is then cut and stored to feed the{dairy herds belonging to the farms. Most of the cattle are Friesians. There is some land which is used for growing{crops}such as wheat, oats, barley and potatoes but this is small compared with the grassland. Some of the area is taken up by fenced fields which are unsown and little fertilised but is also used for grazing.
